questions.question_text:
An organization is struggling to meet user demand for change and wants to modernize their legacy applications by moving the applications to the cloud.

Why would this help the organization satisfy user expectations?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Modernizing legacy applications by moving them to the cloud allows organizations to leverage cloud-native practices and tools such as CI/CD pipelines and DevOps workflows. This helps:

- Accelerate update deployments, enabling rapid bug fixes and feature rollouts.
- Improve responsiveness to user demands for change by adopting agile development practices.
- Reduce downtime and enhance the overall user experience through faster iteration cycles.

Answer should be A.
The user demands are for change. Not for facing issues or fixing bugs.

Selected Answer: A
A caters to the customer's priotity of change

Selected Answer: C
Other options can be realized without moving to the cloud.

Selected Answer: A
I think A is correct. The question was not about bugs or quality issues, so C is not relevant. Though C is also an advantage for cloud solution.
The only one that adds user value directly is A. C: update can just be a fix.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C. Updates can be pushed out more quickly to repair bugs.

Moving legacy applications to the cloud can help organizations satisfy user expectations by enabling them to push out updates more quickly to repair bugs.

Selected Answer: A
Ans is A

Selected Answer: C
For me it's C because the company is trying to meet customer's demand for change and C covers that by mentioning "updates".

Selected Answer: C
for me C

Selected Answer: C
I don't like this question. The word "change" is confusing and should be "improvement". Either way, I'm going with C

Selected Answer: A
A for me
Correct answer C

Selected Answer: A
for me A

choices.B: Toil automation helps make automatic updates
choices.D: DevOps requires that industry trends be measured and tracked
choices.C: Updates can be pushed out more quickly to repair bugs
choices.A: Customer data can be used to offer tailored content

questions.question_text:
An organization is looking for a storage solution that will help them serve content to users worldwide. They need a solution that offers a high level of availability.

What feature of Cloud Storage would they benefit from?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct.
A is correct.

Selected Answer: A
A seems to be the right one.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

Selected Answer: A
https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/storage-data-transfer/choose-between-regional-dual-region-and-multi-region-cloud-storage
Multiple Google Cloud services are managed by Google to be redundant and distributed within and across regions. These services optimize availability, performance, and resource efficiency.

An organization is struggling to ensure that their legacy systems meet rapidly changing IT needs.

Why should the organization use application programming interfaces (APIs)?

choices.A: A combination of different virtualized servers
choices.D: A combination of multiple public cloud provider services
choices.B: A combination of serverless computing and public cloud services
choices.C: A combination of private cloud infrastructure and public cloud services

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C. A combination of private cloud infrastructure and public cloud services

A hybrid cloud architecture combines a private cloud infrastructure with public cloud services. This allows organizations to take advantage of the benefits of both private and public clouds.
C. Hybrid definition is combination of on-premises (private) + public cloud
Answer is C

Selected Answer: C
too easy

Selected Answer: C
C. Nice n easy.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

questions.question_text: What kind of architecture does a hybrid cloud offer organizations?

choices.C: It randomly allocates data to different storage locations to protect against threats.
choices.A: It stores geographically dispersed copies of data to prevent loss.
choices.B: It offers an affordable upgrade that enables data encryption.
choices.D: It has a low minimum storage amount requirement.

discussion.content: I think A is better option.One of the primary benefits of using Google Cloud Storage is that it stores geographically dispersed copies of data to prevent data loss. This means that even if one copy of the data is lost or corrupted, other copies stored in different locations can be used to recover the data.

Selected Answer: A
A: It stores geographically dispersed copies of data to prevent loss.

Cloud Storage is ideal for an international law firm needing to share and access sensitive data securely across branch offices. Its benefits include:

- Geographic redundancy: Cloud Storage automatically replicates data across multiple locations, ensuring high availability and preventing data loss due to localized failures.
- Data security: It includes built-in encryption for sensitive data, both at rest and in transit.
- Scalability: It allows the firm to handle varying amounts of data without worrying about storage limits.

B: is wrong. Data encryption is built-in with Cloud Storage, and thereâ€™s no need for an "affordable upgrade."

Selected Answer: A
B might be technically correct but the answer they are looking for is A. There is a reason they word things the way they do. The keyword there is international.

Selected Answer: B
The question just mentioned sensitive data.. That means data leak or breach is more important rather than data loss. So B should be correct.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.
The question text only mentions the sharing of sensitive data and does not mention the loss described in option A.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A. It stores geographically dispersed copies of data to prevent loss.

One of the key benefits of Cloud Storage is that it stores geographically dispersed copies of data to prevent loss. This is important for an international law firm that needs to be able to share and access varying amounts of sensitive data across their branch offices.

Selected Answer: A
By default - Cloud Storage encrypts data at no additional cost (Cloud Storage always encrypts your data on the server side, before it is written to disk, at no additional charge. - https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/encryption/). This sorts out the sensitive data requirement of the HR company. 
Data Loss is minimised by having geographically dispersed copies. 
Answer B is possible but not required unless the customer wants key storage (HSM units) to secure/manage their cryptographic keys for an additional fee....

Selected Answer: B
Verified Answer = B
Explanation:
1. Data encryption: Cloud Storage uses server-side encryption to encrypt your data by default. You can also use supplemental data encryption options.
Refer- https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/introduction#securing_your_data
2. Cloud Storage always encrypts your data on the server side, before it is written to disk, at no additional charge. Besides this there are additional ways to encrypt your data when using Cloud Storage.
Refer-https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/encryption
3. If you need more control over key operations than what Google-managed encryption keys allows, you can use customer-managed encryption keys.

comments.content:
3. If you need more control over key operations than what Google-managed encryption keys allows, you can use customer-managed encryption keys. These keys are created and managed using Cloud Key Management Service (Cloud KMS), and you store the keys as software keys, in an HSM cluster, or externally.
Refer-https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/encryption/customer-managed-keys

discussion.content: Question Asks about sensitive data. It must be C

Selected Answer: A
A - the correct one

Selected Answer: A
A - redundancy

Selected Answer: A
A is the better option.
Yes, better option is A here.
someone is going to find the right answer for me pls. The exam is coming soon :((((

Selected Answer: C
I don't like B as the answer here. Data is always encrypted. Encryption is not part of an "affordable upgrade". Only other answer that made sense to me is C.

Selected Answer: B
Answer B.

Selected Answer: B
Cloud Storage always encrypts your data on the server side, before it is written to disk, at no additional charge. Besides this standard, Google-managed behavior, there are additional ways to encrypt your data when using Cloud Storage.

questions.question_text:
A large retail organization uses traditional technology for their ecommerce website. During peaks in traffic, resources are often underutilized or overprovisioned. They have decided to migrate to cloud technology.

What aspect of cloud technology will benefit their ecommerce business?

choices.D: Shared responsibility means that the cloud provider brings increased visibility during peaks in traffic.
choices.A: Agile infrastructure means that they only pay for what they need, when they need it.
choices.B: Operational expenditure means that their total cost of ownership is more predictable.
choices.C: Unlimited storage means that their website will never experience downtime.
